channel.title: 508 ip ban command help
channel.description:
Okay guys, all i need is a way to have the command write the ip i want banned in my "bannedhosts.dat" file.
If you can help, ily eternally.

item.title: 508 ip ban command help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:18, topic:344695”]Ip ban command:

else if (cmd[0].equals("ipban")){ String person = playerCommand.substring((playerCommand.indexOf(" ") + 1)); Player p2 = Engine.players[Engine.getIdFromName(person)]; if (p2.rights < 1) { if (p2 != null) { Engine.fileManager.appendData("characters/bannedhosts/" + Server.socketListener.getAddress(p2.socket.socket) + ".txt", p2.username + " has been IpBanned by " + p.username); p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You have just IpBanned " + p2.username); p2.disconnected[0] = true; } } else if (p2.rights >= 1) { p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You cannot ipban staff!"); } } [/quote]What source are you using? Because that’s the same one that I put into DavidScape. So unless you are using my source, someone leeched it >: (

But make sure it’s in the right place, make sure that the player you are trying to ban is online.
Try changing your command to this and tell me what happens:

else if (cmd[0].equals("ipban")){ String person = playerCommand.substring((playerCommand.indexOf(" ") + 1)); Player p2 = Engine.players[Engine.getIdFromName(person)]; if (p2.rights < 1) { if (p2 != null) { Engine.fileManager.appendData("characters/bannedhosts/" + Server.socketListener.getAddress(p2.socket.socket) + ".txt", p2.username + " has been IpBanned by " + p.username); p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You have just IpBanned " + p2.username); p2.disconnected[0] = true; } else { p.frames.sendMessage(p, "That player is not online!"); } } else if (p2.rights >= 1) { p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You cannot ipban staff!"); } }

Read full topic

item.title: 508 ip ban command help
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

Ip ban command:

else if (cmd[0].equals("ipban")){ 
String person = playerCommand.substring((playerCommand.indexOf(" ") + 1));
Player p2 = Engine.players[Engine.getIdFromName(person)];
if (p2.rights < 1) {
if (p2 != null) { 
Engine.fileManager.appendData("characters/bannedhosts/" + Server.socketListener.getAddress(p2.socket.socket) + ".txt", p2.username + " has been IpBanned by " + p.username);
p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You have just IpBanned " + p2.username);
p2.disconnected[0] = true;
}
}
else if (p2.rights >= 1) {
p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You cannot ipban staff!");
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: 508 ip ban command help
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

awmg :’(

when i type ::ipban (username)

in game, nothing happens.

No errors, nothing.

Ip ban command:

else if (cmd[0].equals("ipban")){ 
String person = playerCommand.substring((playerCommand.indexOf(" ") + 1));
Player p2 = Engine.players[Engine.getIdFromName(person)];
if (p2.rights < 1) {
if (p2 != null) { 
Engine.fileManager.appendData("characters/bannedhosts/" + Server.socketListener.getAddress(p2.socket.socket) + ".txt", p2.username + " has been IpBanned by " + p.username);
p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You have just IpBanned " + p2.username);
p2.disconnected[0] = true;
}
}
else if (p2.rights >= 1) {
p.frames.sendMessage(p, "You cannot ipban staff!");
}
}

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:12, topic:344695”]1. I am importing server.java.

  1. .\Bulby\io\packets\Commands.java:1394: package server does not exist Engine.fileManager.appendData("characters/bannedhosts/" + server.socketListener. getAddress(p2.socket.socket) + ".txt", p2.username + " has been IpBanned by " + p.username); ^ .\Bulby\.\io\Login.java:168: cannot find symbol symbol : class File location: class Bulby.io.Login File ipb = new File(filename2); ^ .\Bulby\.\io\Login.java:168: cannot find symbol symbol : class File location: class Bulby.io.Login File ipb = new File(filename2); ^ Note: .\Bulby\players\objectLoader.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Note: .\Bulby\clanchat\Room.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]Oh, try changing the server.socketListener to Server.socketListener

  2. add import java.io.*;

to your imports.

@davidi2 wrote:

Ok good, making progress.

  1. Good, that just means that you didn’t import Server.java

At the top of login.java, copy the line that says ‘import _____.Engine’ and past it right below it. Then change the .Engine to .Server.

  1. Ok, paste the code I gave you either right above or right below that.

item.title: 508 ip ban command help
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

  1. Found it in server.java:
public static void main(String[] args) {
        try {
            socketListener = new SocketListener(Integer.parseInt(args[0]));
        } catch (Exception e) {

            /*
             * If this happens then the specified port is most likely already in use.
             */
            e.printStackTrace();
            return;
        }
        loadBannedUsers();
        engine = new Engine();
	GrandExchangeLoader = new GrandExchangeLoader();
	GrandExchangeLoader.loadOffers();
        playerSave = new PlayerSave();
        socketListener.run();
    }
  1. if (checkBannedUsers(p.username)) { returnCode = 4; }

Read full topic

item.title: 508 ip ban command help
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

First one, no… should i try engine.java?

And my normal ban check is in server.java:

/**
     * Loads all banned users at startup.
     */
    private static void loadBannedUsers() {
        int index = 0;

        try {
            BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
                    new FileReader("./data/banned/bannedusers.dat"));
            String loggedUser = null;

            while ((loggedUser = in.readLine()) != null) {
                bannedUsers[index] = loggedUser;
                index++;
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            Misc.println("Error loading banned users list.");
        }
    }
}

Read full topic

Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Note: .\Bulby\clanchat\Room.java uses unchecked or unsafe operations. item.title: 508 ip ban command help
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:3, topic:344695”]See, that’s what i tried to do, but i failed really hard…

I couldn’t figure out how to make the server load those files.[/quote]
Add this to your IP ban command: (and create a new folder called ‘bannedhosts’ on your characters folder)

Engine.fileManager.appendData("characters/bannedhosts/" + Server.socketListener.getAddress(p2.socket.socket) + ".txt", p2.username + " has been IpBanned by " + p.username);

Then add this somewhere before fileManager.loadCharacter§; :

String filename2 = ("./data/characters/bannedhosts/"+ Server.socketListener.getAddress(p.socket.socket) + ".txt"); File ipb = new File(filename2); if(ipb.exists()) { Misc.println(p.username + " is ipbanned and cant log in."); returnCode = 4; }

Read full topic
